assessments.status_rationale: Today’s items include general tech/AI and market news but nothing indicating ServiceNow has announced (or is about to announce) a definitive agreement to acquire Armis. No acquisition announcement evidence is present.
No referenced news about iRobot, bankruptcy proceedings, or any disclosed signed sale agreement (press release/SEC filing). The prediction remains unresolved.
The Ukraine/Russia bullets focus on military developments and intelligence warnings, not a publicly confirmed direct meeting between official delegations. No meeting confirmation is cited.

Australia-related coverage concerns the Bondi Beach shooting and potential gun-law changes. Nothing indicates the federal government has tabled (introduced) a bill specifically targeting online misinformation/deepfakes or violent-extremist content amplification.
No news items address Chilean politics or legislative actions. There is no evidence regarding submission of an executive-sponsored public security/anti-crime package to the National Congress.
No defense procurement or U.S. Navy contracting announcements are included in today’s bullets; specifically, nothing about a new $1.0B+ shipbuilding-related contract award.
A bullet references Asia-Pacific markets and the KOSPI but does not provide the closing level or confirm a close at/below 2,500. Without the actual close data, the outcome cannot be updated.

The AI/tech bullets discuss financing, infrastructure, and risk offloading, but none mention any hyperscaler (AWS/Azure/Google Cloud) announcing a pilot or customer availability for glass-based archival storage media.
